intro: Senecio whyteanus, commonly known as the Whyte's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Senecio whyteanus is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
